zone.line: blood became intolerable. The shu sw
mids summer sun shone in an
unclouded sky; the air was close but
all was cool to me except my own
scorching skin. Towards evening dark
thunder clouds arose above the horizon
and I heard its distant roll – after
sunset they darkened the whole sky
and it began to rain and the storm
ther the lightning and thunder the
lightning lighted up the whole country
and the thunder drowned the noise of
our carriage. At the nexet next
inu inn my father had not taken
horses; he had left a box there saying
he would return, and had walked
over the fields to the town of ––– a
seacost town eight miles off. For
For a moment I was almost
paralized by fear; but my energy
returned and I demanded a guide to
